text: The term ragout refers to a main-dish stew of meat, poultry, fish or vegetables. It uses "well-seasoned meat and vegetables cooked in a thick sauce".Merriam-Webster dictionary. A typical sauce to use would be roux. ==Etymology== The word is from the French rago청t.pronounced in both languages as "ragoo" The term comes from the French rago청ter, meaning: "to revive the taste". The related word Italian rag첫 is a sauce, such as Rag첫 Napoletano. It is used to dress pasta. ==Preparation== The basic method of preparation involves slow cooking over a low heat. The main ingredients are many; ragouts may be prepared with or without meat, a wide variety of vegetables may be incorporated, and they may be more or less heavily spiced and seasoned. == Notes == Category:French food
title: Ragout
